title: AT THE MOUNTAINS OF MADNESS
subtitle:
Hollywood Pitch Deck v7.1 | Final Package
Cosmic Horror Thriller | Premium Studio Feature
bullets: Tagline: The oldest intelligence on Earth is not hunting us. It is evaluating us.
Final Identity: Engineer-intelligence, human iteration, revelation as horror.

title: The Hook
bullets: A rescue mission enters Antarctica and finds an active system, not a ruin.
The deeper they go, the clearer it becomes: humanity may be one version in a designed cycle.
The film sells dread through discovery, not creature attack patterns.

title: Logline
bullets: A grieving systems scientist leads a polar recovery team into a buried pre-human complex and discovers that Earth has been repeatedly reset.
To bring anyone home, he must choose between exposing the truth and containing it, while evidence suggests he may already be integrated into the evaluating intelligence.

title: Story Summary
bullets: Camp D1 goes silent; a six-person team arrives to retrieve data and personnel.
Inside the camp, evidence points to precise biological investigation, not random violence.
Below the ice they discover an iteration chamber with preserved human and near-human variants.
Keller realizes the core horror: civilization may be a test environment repeatedly reset.
A structural collapse removes the return route. Escape requires moving deeper before moving out.
The Elder Thing completes its analysis and enters the human world. The cycle remains active.

title: 3-Act Spine
bullets: Act I: Recovery mission -> active architecture -> weather clock -> descent decision.
Act II: Iteration evidence -> emotional fracture -> revelation of reset logic.
Act III: No-return escape -> institutional cover -> mirrored ending confirms recurrence.

title: Escalation Ladder (Designed)
bullets: Unbehagen: ordered environment that observes.
Angst: the system is in interaction range, not background range.
Panik: route failure + time compression + team loss.
Kosmischer Horror: humanity as process material, not pinnacle.

title: Opening / Closing Image Mirror
bullets: Opening image: white void, tiny helicopter, distorted signal.
Closing image: same visual grammar, now re-coded as proof of a repeating process.
Meaning shift drives final impact: from mystery to systemic inevitability.

title: Character Profile: Dr. Elias Keller
bullets: Function: lead scientist and narrative lens.
Inner conflict: guilt over his son -> obsession with proof.
Arc: disciplined empiricist -> destabilized witness -> compromised survivor.
Final state: conscious uncertainty over acceptance versus replacement.

title: Character Profile: Dr. Lena Hartmann
bullets: Function: biological authority and ethical counterweight.
Sees Kellers physical anomaly and tracks escalating integration risk.
Arc: scientist-observer -> moral decision-maker -> controlled complicity.

title: Character Profiles: Ensemble
bullets: Baranov: operational realism; buys time through hard tactical choices.
Sato: systems interpreter; names the threat model before anyone else.
Lund: extraction discipline under weather pressure; does not abandon the team.
Alvarez: audience fear proxy; disappearance marks narrative cost.

title: Theme & Revelation
bullets: Core proposition: terror emerges from what is learned, not what attacks.
Revelation line: consciousness itself may be stress-tested across iterations.
Philosophical payload: the species asks if it was born or built.

title: Entity Behavior Rules (Tone Lock)
bullets: Entity grammar is procedural: observe -> approach -> measure -> disengage.
Elder Thing reads as analyzer/protocol executor; Shoggoth reads as adaptive instrument, not free predator.
No slasher cadence: no jump-lunge blocking, no roar language, no chase-for-sport behavior.
Tone guardrail: if a beat reads as "monster attack," staging/audio/VFX are out of policy.
Department policy source: `assets/23_ENTITY_BEHAVIOR_RULE_SET.md`.

title: Visual Direction: North Star
bullets: Exterior world: hostile blankness; interior world: intentional geometry.
Production design prioritizes precision, not chaos.
The frame should feel clinically observed by an older intelligence.

title: Visual Direction: Color, Texture, Light
bullets: Palette: glacial white, carbon black, oxidized steel, emergency amber, arterial red accents.
Texture language: fibrous living composites, surgical cuts, data-like wall reliefs.
Lighting strategy: practical motivated sources plus deep negative space.

title: Visual Direction: Camera & Motion
bullets: Act I: distant observational compositions.
Act II: increasing axial pressure and spatial distortion.
Act III: compressed movement, corridor urgency, objective panic control.

title: Production Scope: Feature Envelope
bullets: Format: 2.39:1 theatrical master, premium sound design, international day-and-date potential.
Target runtime: 115-125 minutes.
Rating target: R for thematic intensity and scientific body-horror implications.

title: Production Scope: Budget / Schedule / VFX
bullets: Budget Scenario A (contained prestige): USD 45M-55M.
Budget Scenario B (expanded spectacle): USD 60M-75M.
Shoot: 55-65 principal days; VFX: 450-650 shots with practical-first pipeline.

title: Production Scope: Execution Plan
bullets: Stage-led tunnel and chamber builds with controlled exterior unit.
Previs required for descent, chamber reveal, and mirror-ending cycle shot.
Risk mitigation: modular sets, plate library, early VFX asset lock.

title: Market Positioning
bullets: Audience: prestige sci-fi/horror global quadrant 18-49 + premium streaming long-tail.
Positioning: elevated cosmic thriller with emotional anchor, not franchise-dependent lore overload.
Comp space: Arrival x The Thing x Annihilation, with harder systems-horror edge.

title: Why This Film Will Make Money
bullets: Commercial lane is proven: elevated sci-fi/horror can overperform when concept and tone are clear.
Revenue stack is multi-window: theatrical awareness + premium streaming long-tail + evergreen library value.
Budget discipline keeps downside protected while preserving upside from global genre audiences.

rows: USD 43M theatrical + strong streaming long-tail value

return_potential: Base Case: contained prestige delivery with durable streaming shelf life.
Upside Case: Arrival-like theatrical breakout if campaign leads with concept + emotion.
Strategic Case: catalog-value title with recurring seasonal and platform relevance.

title: Risk Mitigation + Break-even Scenarios
bullets: Financing logic is built around contained downside and multi-window upside.
Break-even model below is indicative and campaign-dependent (P&A, MGs, and output terms vary by deal).
Design choice: practical-first production and stage control reduce execution variance.
risk_controls: Script and previs lock before VFX heavy sequences to prevent scope drift.
Modular set design to absorb schedule/weather disruption without reset cost.
Creature/architecture pipeline split across vendors with early asset approval gates.
Marketing angle anchored in concept + emotional hook (not pure creature campaign).

title: Studio Ask
bullets: Approve full development package and packaging phase.
Deliverables in 8-10 weeks: budgeted production draft, lookbook, prelim VFX bid, locked schedule.
Packaging target: director with architectural tension command + dramatic lead for Keller.

title: Closing Statement
bullets: This is a contained event film with premium scale and durable thematic afterlife.
Final promise to audience: the terror does not end at survival; it begins at understanding.
